books.title: Honeycomb
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Our protagonist takes a new position as governess for a wealthy family.

books.title: Kim
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: An orphaned street-urchin follows a holy man across India during the time of the British Raj, eventually gaining an education and becoming a recruit to the Great Game of espionage against the Russians.

books.title: Memoirs of a Revolutionist
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: A Russian revolutionary tells of his life from early childhood, his adventures as a geographer, and how he turned into an anarcho-communist.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Beatrix Potter
books.summary: A collection of Beatrix Potter’s short stories for children, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: The Trachiniae
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A woman unintentionally kills her demigod husband with a poisoned robe in a desperate attempt to reclaim his love.

books.title: The Demi-Gods
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Three demi-gods descend among humanity in the form of angels, stumbling upon a father, his daughter, and their donkey traveling around rural Ireland.

books.title: The Dead Secret
books.author: Wilkie Collins
books.summary: A maidservant is forced by her dying mistress to conceal a deep family secret, at great personal cost to herself.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: The Mysterious Affair at Styles
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A fastidious Belgian detective solves the mystery of a murder in an English country manor.

books.title: Aspects of the Novel
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: E. M. Forster offers an analysis of aspects of the novel.

books.title: Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus
books.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
books.summary: One of the most important texts of 20th century philosophy, in which the nature of the philosophy, language, understanding, and logical atomism are explored.

books.title: Mirèio
books.author: Frédéric Mistral
books.summary: Two young Provençal lovers are kept apart by their social class.

books.title: Northanger Abbey
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A young girl with an overactive imagination comes of age.

books.title: The Survivors
books.author: Tom Godwin
books.summary: A group of humans stranded on a deadly planet try to survive the harsh conditions and take revenge on the aliens that left them there.

books.title: Fifty-One Tales
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A series of otherworldly short stories ranging from the moral to the whimsical.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
